body_content.explanation: a shape that has been cut out from something, especially a flat one that can stand vertically:
examples: Fed-up residents have resorted to using cardboard cutouts of children placed near the edge of the road so that passing drivers will see them and slow down.
I had my photo taken with a life-size cut-out of the actor.

body_content.explanation: a space made in something such as a material or object by cutting part of it out:
examples: You can make cut-outs in the dough with cookie cutters if you like.
The glow of the candle shines through star-shaped cutouts.

body_content.explanation: a device that, for safety reasons, stops or interrupts a circuit, used, for example, in a motor or engine:
examples: A safety cut-out had switched off the power when she opened the hatch.

body_content.explanation: (of a shape) having been cut out from something:
examples: The model scenery even had a green mountain and a sky with cutout stars.

body_content.explanation: (of an object, piece of clothing) having holes in it made by cutting parts out:
examples: Forget bikinis, there's only one item to wear on the beach this summer and that's a cut-out swimsuit.
